comments.body:
This is good but feels like it should be in `docs/` somewhere. Ok to leave that for later.

Because this is in `internal`, it won't show up in API docs, so it's unlikely anyone will see this or call these methods. Even if they do, `internal` means it can break at any point...
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,105 @@

+package org.apache.spark.internal.io
+
+import org.apache.spark.SparkConf
+import org.apache.spark.sql.internal.SQLConf
+
+/**
+ * Package object to assist in switching to the Hadoop Hadoop 3
+ * [[org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.output.PathOutputCommitterFactory]] factory
+ * mechanism for dynamically loading committers for the destination stores.
+ *
+ * = Using Alternative Committers with Spark and Hadoop 3 =

comments.body: yep. It is needed in the docs, with `docs/cloud-integration.md` the obvious place. But really that "build on Hadoop 3.1" is a prereq, isn't it?
